attributes.action: Implement a ten year transition period of dual measurements for road distances and traffic speeds. This would involve showing both miles and kilometres on road signs. Speeds would be stated in both miles per hour (mph) and kilometres per hour (kph).
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A ten year period of dual use of miles/mph and kilometres/kph would provide the general public with an opportunity to use whichever they preferred. It would give people time to become more familiar with kilometres, as a prelude to full metrication. It would also make it easier for tourists and other visitors to understand UK road distances and traffic speeds, because they are likely to only be familiar with kilometres/kph.

During the first half of the ten year period, miles/mph would be the primary measure and kilometres/kph would be secondary. During the second half of the ten year period, the situation would be reversed.

In that sense, it would be similar to the transition from Fahrenheit to Celsius that has taken place over the past decade.
